DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare effect topical ( Rimexolone versus Dexamethasone ) IOP child 13 year age underwent bilateral strabismus surgery , compare effect topical ( Rimexolone versus Fluorometholone ) IOP child 13 year age underwent bilateral strabismus surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Ocular-hypertensive Response Topical Steroids Children After Bilateral Strabismus Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Children age 13 year undergoing bilateral strabismus surgery Cairo University Hospitals ( Cairo University Specialized Pediatric Hospital Kasr Al Ainy Hospital ) . randomize use simple randomization method , computer software randomization , two equal group : - First group : One eye randomize receive topical 0.1 % Dexamethasone , whereas fellow eye receive topical 1 % Rimexolone four time per day 2 week . - Second group : One eye randomize receive topical 0.1 % Fluorometholone , whereas fellow eye receive topical 1 % Rimexolone four time per day 2 week . IOP measure day operation use Tono-Pen® . Three reliable measurement obtain eye mean take . IOP measure postoperative week 1 , 2 , 3 , 4 6 use Tono-Pen® .
DOC.criteria: Children young 13 year age . Children underwent bilateral recession strabismus surgery . Preoperative IOP 21.00 mmHg less , cupdisc ratio 0.3 less . The absence systemic disease ocular disease ( apart strabismus ) eye . Children comply IOP measurement use TonoPen® , type anesthesia use , except topical anesthesia . Patients 13 year age old . Children need resection muscle surgery , surgery vertical , oblique muscle . Preoperative IOP 21.00 mmHg , cupdisc ratio 0.3 Family history glaucoma high myopia . A history steroid usage past year . Failure comply IOP measurement followup schedule .
